he Counting House was the center of trade and business in Baldurs Gate, serving as both a bank and establishment that facilitated the exchange of various currencies.
It was located on the waterfront of The Steeps, overlooking Gray Harbor.
The Counting House was a fortress-like building with dense walls. Its top two floors were entirely windowless.
The seemingly impenetrable structure descended deep beneath the streets of Baldurs Gate. Its subterranean, cylindrical floors served as vaults that stored the shared wealth of many Baldurian patriar families. Stone golems served as sentries
and guardians for these riches, patrolling the Counting Houses deepest corridors.
The counting house was founded by Magnate Carric Ilphescient of Baldurs Gate and soon after the bank became one of the major contributors to the Gates economic successes. The Counting House earned a number of wealthy patrons and supporters over the years with the most loyal among them earning a special place among the banks Record of the Honored. It included the Shattershield family whose money allowed the bank to upgrade its vaults Lady Isabella Bormul, who donated seven carts of Amnian silver Grand Dukes Abdel Adrian, Liia Jannath, and Belt, for their contributions following the Iron crisis of the , as well as Lord Daryn Silvershield, whose generous donation was so impressive, it too the bank a tenday to count.
In the , the Counting House commissioned expensive repairs to the banks vaults and the mechanical systems after the sublevels were flooded due to regular earthquakes caused by the Netherbrain hidden underneath the city. The repair included draining seawater and reinforcing the sublevel walls, however, Gondian Guild was to be contacted for any magical defenses repair. The physical repair was a hefty sum, and Gondian repairs would cost even more, especially if the damage were to be repeated.
